intro: Comesperma uncinatum, commonly known as the hooked comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It typically grows in sandy soils in coastal areas and is often found in heathlands. Comesperma uncinatum is a shrub that can reach up to 2 meters in height, with branches that often have hooked tips.
